website_summaries.verdict: You can spend more money on a similar kit, but there's no need to – this one has the components you need to complete most jobs for a fraction of the price.
pros: Comes with a handy case and ample tools including a sturdy jig with 4 board thickness settings
Pieces are durable, and tool fanatics rave about the quality and the budget-friendly price
cons: Doesn't come with instructions but owners brag about an instructional online video that is very helpful

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE TO YESTERDAY'S REVIEW: Works well until...
customer_reviews.text: ...the pilot tip breaks. Would have been a great tool if it were to last a bit longer than 3 months! UPDATE: reported the defect to Milescraft and they responded less than 24 hrs later sending a replacement bit at no charge. Happy with purchase, and happier with customer service. Now I can complete the small bath cabinet I'm building.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Say No to Kreg prices. Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: If you bought the similar Kreg jig then you got screwed....this thing is AWESOME. I even used the Kreg jig screws and bits with it because the screws for this thing are not easy to find in box stores for some reason. I build two 2x4 stools with this thing for my billiards room and it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Uptegrow

customer_reviews.title: Horrible T20 Drivers - Great Jig!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the Pocket Jig 100 kit as well. I love both jigs, however the T20 star drivers didn't make it through the first time use. The two T20 star drivers that came with this set stripped within the first couple of hours. The jig itself is awesome and is very easily adjusted to the thickness differences of the wood being used. As compared to the Kreg Jigs I already own, this is a simple easy jig to use and should be considered as a first pick when looking to buy a portable pocket hole jig system. I would however switch over to Kreg square drivers and screws.
customer_reviews.author: New York DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to save a couple bucks when I started to build a bookcase for my wife. Got through about 5 sets of holes and one of the metal guides grabbed the drill bit and tore it out of the unit. So after banging the guide off the bit I glued it back into the plastic and then had to sand the drill bit so it wouldn’t keep getting stuck. Overall it works ok. If I was looking to buy a kit again I’d just get the kreg one that’s similar to this. The frustration was not worth the savings.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigD

customer_reviews.title: The quality on this is very good, and a fraction of the cost of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Pocket Hole Joints are Pocket Hole Joints... They either work, or they do not. The quality on this is very good, and a fraction of the cost of the blue ones from the company that starts with the letter K. I love that company (K) but why on earth pay more for a tool that does less. This thing is good to go. Hard to believe I'm giving it 5 stars, but the price alone is worth the price of admission.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative, but buy a high quality bit right away.
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time today. Works like a charm and much less expensive than the blue competitor. Knocked off a star because the star(torx) drive bits stripped out in the first few screws. They're made from a very inferior metal. Also, the first couple pockets will churn out some black plastic from the jig. It stopped, but made me question if I made a mistake, but all is well. Recommend buying extra screws right away on here too.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Witman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product instead on the blue one due to the price and online reviews. I wanted to make sure I was going to continue doing woodworking projects before I invested in the blue one. Now, I see no need to buy the other one! This has worked great! Does exactly what I need it to and at a fraction of the cost. Since I haven't used the other I can't compare, I can say this has worked great for my novice projects.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne R.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Metal part of the jig hole got stuck the drill bit and came out (see picture)
customer_reviews.author: benjamin levine

customer_reviews.title: Big savings, gets job done!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted a pocket hole jig for a long time but did not want to pay the outrageous mark up for a name brand. I’m a novice builder if I were to qualify myself, doing a lot of various home projects but not building full on furniture. I ordered this to complete a built in shelf unit I was putting into my bathroom and was very happy with it. The instructions were clear enough to understand and it came with everything I needed for my first project. I even ordered the Milescraft face clamp to use with it (also a great product) and had no issues! So glad I purchased this one instead of the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, directions are easy to read, has everything you need and you save some money over a Kreg jig. I have wanted to start using pocket holes for a while but kept holding off because of price. This Milescraft kit really does the trick for me. I highly recommend the kit.
customer_reviews.author: jansvendsen60

customer_reviews.title: QA Issue; Returned for Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Note the photos. The drill bit cannot pass through one of the jig holes. It got stuck. Likely a manufacturer error where the plastic and metal are too tight and/or misaligned. Waiting on replacement. The case is useful. There is an empty slot for Milescraft's 2-inch face clamp that's sold separately. Why there isn't an option to buy them together--i don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Merrick K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Drill bit does not fit on one hole
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product 1 star for the following reasons. The product could have been good except on of the hole does not fit the bit. The metal interfere and can not be be force because the bit is braking. I asked for a replacement and hoping that it does not have the same issue. The manual also is difficult to understand especially for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Esel

customer_reviews.title: Why spend so much for the same thing?
customer_reviews.text: You "could" buy the kregjig. You could spend a bunch of money for the same thing. BUT WHY? I built an entire cabinet with this tool in my camper and I only had a recip saw and a drill. This was so easy. Sure it doesn't come with a clamp, you have to buy a clamp but this and the clamp still less then the name brand. It's got a cool carry tote and it's super easy to use. Measure out your distance, lock the ring, clamp the tool down and drill the hole. Know your board thickness as you will drive a screw through the front of the board if it's to long.
customer_reviews.author: clarnp49

customer_reviews.title: Good value but some negatives
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because the thickness settings are indexed and do not allow for an easy way to compensate for slight variations in wood thickness or thicknesses that the unit are not indexed for such as custom milled wood stock. The storage case insert is flimsy. The directions are difficult to follow. The bores are slightly undersized so there is some resistance when drilling and the drill does remove some bits of plastic. Rated slightly higher because it works and is a good value, but there are some negatives. You get what you pay for with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracker180

customer_reviews.title: Good, economic, useful.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this over the more recognized name product, assuming it would be good enough for my occasional use. It is, and then some. The kit is fairly complete, missing some kind of clamp that you must provide. I use a small c-clamp and find that the magnetic insert on the clamp base ones in handy. There are enough screws included to get a feel for the tool, they are torx head, as are the two bits. The local hardware stores have square head on the shelf, so I've added those bits to the kit. Overall I've used this on several projects and it's performed very well. I can't compare to higher priced versions, but this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W

customer_reviews.title: Better than the competitor
customer_reviews.text: I had a competitor's pocket hole set that I misplaced during our recent cross-country move. I needed to make some pocket holes, but I didn't want to pay $40 for a new blue jig when I knew I had one hiding in a box somewhere. I bought this Milescraft jig based on the price and the reviews, and I could not be happier. In my opinion, this is a slightly better set, or at least as good, but $14 less. I also like the fact that Milescraft uses a star bit instead of the square bit. The star bit doesn't slip nearly as often.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Not a Kreg
customer_reviews.text: The price of Kreg jigs is absurd and I wanted to get into making pocket holes. I found this to be the perfect entry jig and I don't really see myself needing anything more ever. A bigger static jig might be nice if you're going to make a big assembly line but for a hobbyist, this is all you need. I do recommend getting a good metal clamp that takes advantage of the magnet, it makes things way less frustrating. Also make sure you have a strong drill and don't overheat the drill bit too much. My ancient black and decker is getting a little weak so drilling can be a little tedious but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: The Milescraft pocket jig works really well. I got the kit as a cheap way to test out making pocket hole joinery. But the kit is actually really great. It's super easy to use and the makers threw in a bunch of quality-of-life stuff like a long and short T-20 bit and quick release bit holder. I don't think they needed to do that, but it's really nice that they did. Be sure to have a face clamp to use with the jig. If you do than making pocket holes is fast and easy. I built a big cabinet the other day and really got into a speedy groove using this thing. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but worked.
customer_reviews.text: First off the item arrived with the screws strown all inside the box. REALLY cheap inside tray. Threw it away and used my own box. The jig works as described. My 17 yr old son and I reinforced his hand built desk. After a few holes I can already tell the item is a little cheap. I'm not sure it'll last very long. A little better plastic material would make for an excellent jig. The kit is fairly priced against Kreg, which I have not used. All in all I like the jig. It did the job well once you route out the plastic part of the holes with the bit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easier than you think
customer_reviews.text: My first project was a outdoor planter box 8x2x13. I used over 225 screws on the project and this little jig with the included drill did the job. The drill countersink tips became a little rounded near the end of the job but some of the wood was pressure treated 2x4s. Otherwise this model worked great. It is a little cheaper than the other kind but my carpenter friend says the drill held up well. Take your time and jog the drill in and out to clean the chips and the kit will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Partime

customer_reviews.title: The quick change bit wore out on the very first job.
customer_reviews.text: Comes in nice case and driver and drill bits are ok. The quick change bit wore out on the very first project. Wouldn't release the bits. Ended up having to pull them out with pliers. Since I used the screws and plugs that came in the kit, I decided I wouldn't return it. I guess the cost was fair for those and the drill bit. Bought this to replace the one-hole Kreg pocket hole tool I was using. Ended up going back to it bcs, this pocket hole tool was so difficult to keep clamped to the boards. Could have been my clamping technique but I had no problem with the little Kreg.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had some 'teeth'
customer_reviews.text: I contemplated getting the Kreg's version (too expensive) but settled for this one: Teeth you said: I wish it had teeth at the bottom of the tool so that when you are drilling the holes it does not move!!! Even with heavy-duty clamps, it moved a few mm but that makes a big difference in what you are doing. My project didn't have to be that accurate hence why I gave it more stars, however, in future projects I may consider getting the Kreg's more expensive kit ($99)
customer_reviews.author: Donato Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I'd prefer a jig with adjustable angles of attack but I thought I'd give this one a try. The drill bit itself is slightly larger than one of the holes. The hole that appears too small is actually the right size, the other hole is too big and the drill bit is also too big by a few microns. I used some cutting oil and actually worked the bit into the sleeve with a drill press and wore the bit down as well as opened the hole a bit. Now it works as advertised. I shouldn't have to modify the tool when I buy it. Sounds like others have had this problem and no one addressed it at the company.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ben

customer_reviews.title: For the price, does exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Expect the drill bit to have to cut the bushing a little bit at first and the edge stop isn't very sturdy, but if you aren't drilling pocket holes all day this will likely serve for many weekend projects. I took a star off because the sample screws and long drivers at T20 not S2 like literally every other pocket hole screw in existence. So I had to also buy a long S2 square driver too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chubb

customer_reviews.title: Drill bit is cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Bit broke on first use. Of course 1 week late on hitting the return window
customer_reviews.author: Steven George

customer_reviews.title: fell apart on first project
customer_reviews.text: The metal tube came out of the plastic. Company offered a refund....had to buy another product from lowes to finish the job that day.
customer_reviews.author: matthew mckerr

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This kit works amazing. I never thought I'd be able to do the fancy pocket joinery myself. Has nearly everything you need and a small sampling of screws. I recommend you buy more of the size u use. Excellent instructions provided The build of the jig itself is mostly plastic, but has metal parts where needed. The only other thing youd need is a electric drill/driver AND a couple of clamps to hold the jig in place while you drill. Maybe some wood glue if you wanna look like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: First time pocket hole creator / believer for life
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this kit since June (2019) to build 60" tall 3/4 arcade cabinet. It works great with 1/2" MDF. Once I get the sides and front and rear support panels in place using just pocket holes and the screws my cabinets turn out real steady. Using this setup once I learned how it works is a breeze. They are cheap enough that I would buy one for each thickness in materials I could possibly work with, but right now I'm just working with 1/2" sheets and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin DeVane

customer_reviews.title: It isn't but it is a good tool. It's made a little differently than the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift but I have carefully looked at it after seeing a review on YouTube calling this a Kreg killer. It isn't but it is a good tool. It's made a little differently than the Kreg but both tools will do the job. This is a very good and complete kit with screws and drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Honda Fan

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to clamp this down so it doesn’t move without damaging the wood or breaking this clamp. While I was able to get it to work it was a hassle Nothing broke as it has for others You will need to drill intthe Jig first as the drill bit is larger than the actual jig I assume this is so it is a custom fit maybe??? It does come with everything you would need I think these type of jugs maybe just was not what I needed for use in the wood I used. If you are using this on pine it would probably work just make sure you can clamp it down good.
customer_reviews.author: Captainamer

customer_reviews.title: Get extra screws...you'll use all of one size 1st project
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up & use. Screws are really just a sample (maybe enough for one repair). Order more with it (1 1/4 for 3/4 plywood would be my suggestion). I also got kregg driver bits as I can buy the kregg screws at home depot. Only negative is the case (designed for display instead of function)...plastic insert takes up 3/4 of the room to lift everything to the top & leaves no room for additional screws. With this size there should be enough room for 100 of each size screw...I'll fix that with a wood insert to organize & make it more useful. It is entirely plastic except for drill guides, but for the price a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: After many years buying from Amazon and never leaving a negative review, i'm pressed to write my first one as this product left a lot to be desired. I was replacing a Kreg jig that i used for many years but that i misplaced, and was intrigued by this option that looked similar and was slightly cheaper. It turned out to be the wrong decision, I was only able to drill 4 pocket holes before it failed miserably with the 5th one. One of the metal guide cylinders broke free from the jig and got stuck to the bit. I would recommend that you spend a few dollars more for the Kreg Pocket Jig and stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Live and learn.
customer_reviews.text: BLUF: Both T20 bits stripped after only around 10 screws each. And the jig moves no matter how much clamping pressure. Was new to working with pocket holes. Bought this one after watching a YouTube comparison to the leading brand, which highlights some decent features. This was ok for practice projects, but I’ll be buying the leading brand for kitchen cabinetry.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: First time use and the steel bushing grabbed to the pocket bit. Read instructions and watched YouTube video prior to beginning use. Perhaps this is a defective unit but quality does not seem that great especially with the bushing coming loose within the 1st use.
customer_reviews.author: tatiniki2

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jig, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This little jig is great, I have been using it every other day and it’s performed flawlessly. The only gripe I have is that the little endstop that swivels around is flimsy plastic and would function much better if it was aluminum or something more rigid. Mine kinda curves away from the jig and doesn’t “lock” into place the way it’s supposed to. Over all though it still works as it should and I’m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent alternative to the other more expensive pocket hole jigs. I already own a kreg k4 jig and got this one for a more portable option and have been extremely satisfied with it so far. I like that it includes just about everything you need besides a clamp. The only downside I've seen with it is the screws that come with it and the driver bits are torqs head, I usually prefer them but most pocket hole screws out right now are all square drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: After doing the research, I knew that I wanted the milescraft version of the pocket hole jig. When I got it, everything was fine and the product was robust. My issue is the depth gauge is not flush with the 1/2” and that bothers me a lot. At first, I thought it was to compensate for the fence, but that would mean everyone else’s is messed up. Haven’t used it yet, trying to get a replacement. Update: Upgrade from 3 stars to 4. Contacted Milescraft and sent them pictures of my defected product and they are sending a new one in its place. Customer service was awesome! Knocked a star for obvious reasons, otherwise a 5
customer_reviews.author: Christian Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Only half was usable
customer_reviews.text: The kit was ok for the money, but only one of the drill guides was usable. The bushing on the right side was machined too small to accept the drill bit provided. Left side worked fine. See the photos. I didn't want to delay the project with returns so I accepted that it half worked and used it anyway. The side that worked was fine - easy and accurate enough. I marked them down in accuracy because of their lack of it in the manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: newfoundland

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Jig Review.
customer_reviews.text: Have'nt used the jig yet but upon inspection it seems it will work fine. Package was a mess though and came in a bubble mailer when it should have been boxed to protect the cheap case. Mine came with a tab broken off but luckily it didnt hurt the function of the case. Screw, quick connector and bits were all over the place and I had to sort them all once opened. Case is cheap but for $26 bucks compared to 50-100$ I expected as much.
customer_reviews.author: D. Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have NEVER used one of these until I needed it. Worked like a champ. Beware that the first time, the PLASTIC is too tight for the drillbit, and you will be "fixing" that by drilling the plastic a bit wider. It scared me, I had to RTFM to find out it's normal/expected. I liked having different screws to choose from!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Wolak

customer_reviews.title: Works well and less expenses BUT...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works as well as the Kreg. However, it comes with Torx bits, which tend to be a little difficult to get via big box stores as pocket screws. I picked up a square driver bit and kept on my merry way. If you buy screws online than this will not be an issue for you. If you buy this for a project, make sure you are prepared ahead of time. Otherwise, you might encounter a delay in either locating proper fasteners or picking up a square bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this purchase. The first use, the drill bit bound up inside the bushings and pulled the bushings out of the holes. Later it completely stripped one bushing out the hole, making it so nm I could only use the other hole. I had to beat drill bit out each. I was able to finish the project, but the jig got so hot I had to handle it with a rag to keep from burning my hands when I moved from hole to hole.
customer_reviews.author: nick niemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Put together a coffee table with this thing. Here are a few positives. Easy to measure and set up stopper on drill bit. The overall use is pretty straight forward. Having everything included in 1 kit is very handy. Now here are the negatives. -Drilled multiple pocket holes and none of the plugs fit in correctly. Had to sand them down to fit. -The quick connect tool was very cheap and jammed up a lot. -as tight as I try to make it the stopper on the drill bit seems to become loose or slide with very little use. Not sure if anyone has similar experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great product but beware dull drill bit
customer_reviews.text: Love the product but the drill bit isn’t sharp. Leaves pocket holes with tear out. Not sure if this is common or just a manufacturing defect. Going to have to buy another bit for this as it’s too much of a hassle to clean up every pocket hole. I highly recommend the product compared to other brands but beware of a possible issue with bit sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Almost Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So this is my second one of these kits sent to me from Amazon. The Jig works fine the constant problem I had with both kits are the T20 Bits. Each kit has 2 bits, a 4 inch and a 6 inch. All 4 bits must be made of aluminum because they all stripped within installing less that 20 screws. The first kit I received the bits stripped within screwing in 4-5 screws. So now I need to go buy bits to use these. Without the bits this kit is useless.
customer_reviews.author: crickett

customer_reviews.title: Good Milescraft's customer service but questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: After making approximately 20 holes, the drill bit got jammed in the bushing causing it to come out of the jig (see the photo). Contacted Milescraft's customer service, they replied fast and they are shipping a new PocketJig200 and 3/8" PH Drill Bit. The problem is likely because the bushing is made of aluminum (soft and sticky); it will be "bitten" by a steel bit and the drill bit will be jammed. I saw that the other company makes the bushing from steel (should be more durable).
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Zemlianov

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Broke on third hole.
customer_reviews.text: Followed all instructions as well as YouTube videos. On third hole guide sleeve stripped out of jig and seized onto drill bit making the entire tool useless. My mistake to expect a plastic product to work at all. Don’t waste your time with this product and spend on a quality jig.
customer_reviews.author: RPF

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable - Easy to Use Tool
customer_reviews.text: Milescraft's - PocketJig 200 is a great little tool. It is easy to use, economical tool that allows a novice hobbyist (me) to produce great looking woodworking pieces! I highly recommend this jig to anyone looking to take their woodworking projects to the next level, without breaking the bank doing it!
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but not good quality
customer_reviews.text: This jig make it very easy to join wood panel without glue. Although this jig quality is substandard. After using it for a week, metal piece from the hole came out. It is still usable but now i have to be very careful and after everytime i use i have to make sure drill is not very hot and metal piece is secured in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is not the most study tool in my toolbox but it got the job done. Can't be beat for the money. I would advise looking for a heaver duty model if you plan on doing hundreds of pocket holes but if you just need to do a few on occasion this is the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: The kit came with the wrong drill bit for the jig, didn't have the set screw for the locking collar. It's completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Weaks

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I like the price. I didn't like the quality. The guide is plastic and the bit is suppose to ream it out to size, however that wasn't the actual case. The bit isn't sharp where it needs to be to ream the guide so it doesn't work as good as they advertise in the video. It did serve the purpose for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again. Pick the right kit for screw length.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great on 2x4 framing. Latch comes open if my impact rattles so I had to learn to keep my thumb on it. I’ve done at least 100 of them and still going. I use a good clamp to hold it in place or the bit walks across the wood. Screws in the kit go fast.
customer_reviews.author: Snowmobilejohn

customer_reviews.title: end stop is bad. made my own
customer_reviews.text: The thin plastic end stop looked so weak I made my own replacement out of a modified mold and some liquid abs plastic. now that I have the mold, if my stop breaks, I'll just pour a new one. I didn't need the stop that came with the jig as I just used some modeling clay to make a flat stop that fit the jig. not pretty but it works. other than the stop the jig works as described.
customer_reviews.author: andyl

customer_reviews.title: Works well at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I recommend buying the Milescraft Pocket screw kit to go with this. Does exactly what its supposed to do alot cheaper than the blue brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Cheaper than the blue brand and I imagine ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Cheaper than the blue brand and I imagine works just as well. Perfectly drilled pocket screw holes and instructions were easy to understand for a beginner like me. I would recommend and buy again. Seems to be durable and should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Used it on one project
customer_reviews.text: Read the directions before use. Practice three times on scrap wood before using on the project. Don't over tighten the screws, there is not enough wood for that error. The screws are engineered to tighten the opposing peace to the one you are drilling. Those special type screws are necessary, do not use ordinary tapered screw.. Once you trained you, the product does work.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a poker hole jig and didn’t want to spend a lot at the big box stores since I wouldn’t use it very often, so I bought this one for my first jig and so far so good. I do DIY project here and there and it made things easier and look much better. I would recommend this to anyone that needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Comes in a case with everything pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a kreg equivalent without the price and this didn't disappoint. Only gripe would be the lack of ports for the chips to come out but I used the included drill bit to remedy that without problems. Has a built in depth setter for the drill bit as well. The bit for the screws is torx so if you're planning on using kreg screws, get the bit as well.
customer_reviews.author: SGT S

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: It seems like the jig is well made, but in the pictures it shows some sort of metal liners where the bit passes through the jig. The one I received has no such liners. When fitting the provided bit into the ABS jig, it is really tight and it would seem that the bit might chew on the ABS and make it not as accurate after a few uses. That being said, I have not been able to use it yet so my fears may be unfounded.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dover

customer_reviews.title: Good occasional use tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's OK. Occasional use. I learned how to use the technology, but a better, more expensive, easier to use, unit would have been a better first purchase if you intend to use it more than a few times a month...
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tew

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Hole Jig
customer_reviews.text: Made really well and at a great price. Definitely like supporting smaller companies. The only complaint is the case it comes in isn't the greatest quality, but that's not a big deal since I'll probably store it in a tool box or something anyway. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. The different measurements don’t end up screwing into the wood differently in any way, The exit hole is too high up no matter what you do. The part slips around on the wood even when clamped causing me to have to try and hold it down (still doesn’t work) and then the hole is off/scratches around the hole from the drill moving. Then, literally 5 minutes into use, the tip of the drill bit completely broke off into my wood. The kit is nice that it comes with everything and it feels like it would be a sturdy tool, but it’s not working out.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Holman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for money.
customer_reviews.text: This jig is a great value for your money. It's not a super high end jig but it gets the job done and works great. I've used it several times and everytime I use it I love it. It makes joining wood a whole lot easier and the quality of the product is great for the money. I would buy this again and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Used it to build my awesome work bench, ended up stripping out one side, have no idea how that happened as I dont put alot of pressure on it, I think if I were using this alot I would go with the Korean expensive brand
customer_reviews.author: Nate101

customer_reviews.title: One of best things I bought when building out a van
customer_reviews.text: This little tool was clutch for doing a van life build-out. When our project was done, I actually wished I still had more work to do with this little guy. Easy to use (just remember to adjust the depth for shorter/longer depths). Loved this thing! I had no issues with the quality or durability of this tool. A+
customer_reviews.author: Adam Drewry

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product they are a user friendly company. The product is well thought out and I couldn't be happier. I will be buying more of this brand products with confidence in their quality.
customer_reviews.author: golf couple

customer_reviews.title: Accessories not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Jig works good. The drill bits were the biggest disappointment. I liked that they were star bits vs Kreg's square bits, but the drill bit included must have been made of a weak metal. The drill bit stripped after a few screws. Now I need to buy a new drill bit to use the pocket screws.
customer_reviews.author: WaCEE

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. Sleeves slide out and stuck on the bit. Spend more money and get a better setup
customer_reviews.author: Larissa.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Plastic where it should be metal
customer_reviews.text: Its all plastic, except the aluminum bushings. Ot adjustes easily but comes loose just as easy. I used it to build a bunk bed, did the job, but i am doubting it will last for many projects. Worry about the flip stop breaking off, no idea why they would make that part so flimsy. Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Eroc

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: Great product for diy project. Instructions arent too clear but a quick google and a few hit and miss tries will get you going. My only thing is that I wish it was more accurate regarding depth of the hole. It might be too small for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good alternative to more expensive jigs!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to put together a wardrobe frame made of 2x4's. Everything worked great. The adjustable fence for proper drilling position came in very handy. I would not have known where to drill with the more expensive Kreg jig that has no alignment fence. Only issue I had was that it was a little unclear in how to use the gauge for setting the stopper on the drill bit. Once I figured it out though, everything worked great. The magnet holding it to the clamp took a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Schermetzler

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Saved some money Easy to use Fast setup Cons: The drill bit causes bad tear out The drill bit is cheap and breaks I have had this pocket hole jig set for 7 months now and have used it for over 150 pocket holes until 2 weeks ago the tip of the drill bit snapped off and hit me in the face, it also bent the quick connect bit. Replaced it with a better drill bit and it works like new.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: used this to build a projector screen frame, honestly since it doesn't come with a C-clamp you're going to need your own, also the instructions aren't clear on how to set the drill stop, and i'm an aircraft mechanic, so that's saying something
customer_reviews.author: Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Sharp to Dull
customer_reviews.text: The bit that it comes with seems to not fit properly when drilling in the allotted holes to function. It gets stuck and when drilling it gets hot wearing out the tip of the drill bit. Now it doesn't go through the wood any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Lolagi S Lavatai

customer_reviews.title: Nice pocket jig
customer_reviews.text: Nice little pocket jig. After a few trials, I figured out how to use the jig.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product just does not work and is a waste of money. Wish I had done better research before buying it. The provided drill bit is thicker than the pocket hole and got stuck. Overall low quality product as the manual and product do not match. As shown in the picture the groove should have been on the opposite side, as per the manual. I bought the product and it kept sitting for a month and I did not get to use it then and now the return window as expired and now I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sohail Zafar

customer_reviews.title: A jig which works
customer_reviews.text: The tool worked very well but i had a little problem knowing which screws to use which would keep it snug. But I figured it out and then things started to fit perfectly. Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t have have one, you need one.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I didn’t have one of these sooner, they make your projects look so much cleaner and more professional. Definitely will be an essential tool to always keep around my garage.
customer_reviews.author: amj991

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a Kreg
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur wood worker and just recently started to really learn how to work with wood. I'm no where near (as far tools are concerned) as some of the guys I see on YouTube. I'm learning as I go and I don't have the money like some guys do but when I'm able to find a tool for a decent price, I'll but it. This jig has been a time saver and I'm pleased with the way it has made my projects look good. It's easy to use and its been a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Collazo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is not bad for that price. It was affordable that is why i bought it. After a while the little plastic end on the jig got loose which is not good. In general i recommend it if you do not have enough money to buy the very good one. I have done many many project with this jig and i am happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Ferika Farooghi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I used this to help build an armoire and it did its job, once I learned how to use it. Worked great, no complaints, we will have to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: No adjustment on the angle.
customer_reviews.text: The measurement settings aren’t correct, & there is no adjustment. The angle of the screw almost goes through the wood. You can actually see the screw. Every screw I used did just like the picture above. I even used a smaller screw, didn’t make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jig for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This jig did everything that the more expensive K jig does, but at a better price. It also has extra widgets attached that make setup super easy. There are not a lot of included screws in the kit, but hey, at least they give you a few.
customer_reviews.author: Kinetic Customs

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Tool
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would of had this tool earlier when we were building our farm table and corner hutch. Without question will make future projects a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jacobelli

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement from Kreg
customer_reviews.text: Great value for your money. If you don't want to pay the ridiculously high price for Kreg, I would definitely recommend this product. The only issue I have is the screw heads. They are little bit weak plus the heads are little different from Kreg screws. I had to purchase a screw set to match jigs since I can't get them at my local store.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the blue guys for less $$$
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper and works great. As well or even better than the blue one.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A.

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of spending more money on a similar Kreg version. Honestly, I did not have high expectations though. I used it for the first time this weekend and I was thoroughly pleased. It was simple to use with the rail that catches the end of the wood and the clear markings for wood thickness and for setting the collar on the drill bit. No issues with the drill bit either. This is a great addition to the toolbox for any diyer who has an infrequent need to drill pocket holes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great tool easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this is a great tool for pocket holes and it was perfect for my budget. It was really to use and came with different screw sizes. First time user and project done.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barco

customer_reviews.title: Terrific value and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Wanting one for years, I finally had a project that I could justify it's cost - and it was not that expensive to start with. A terrific tool. Only thing missing was instructions (a big loss) but you tube had a great video specifically for this model.
customer_reviews.author: George Brockman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. The guide drill holes have metal cylinders in them which are too small for the drill bit. On first use, one of the metal cylinders came out of the hole and got stuck on this bit. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should own this tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me make a barn door for my bathroom. Worked great. Easy to use. Came with everything I needed. Never could have done it without this tool. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: The jig is marked with dimensions.
customer_reviews.text: I own the Kreg jig (marked with dimensions) and the Kreg mini; both work well but the Milescraft jig is marked so I know exactly which setting to use. The Kreg's are going to my friends with a nod to Milescraft also.
customer_reviews.author: jbroham

customer_reviews.title: Oh, the things you can build.....
customer_reviews.text: Storage cabinets for the chicken feed, a patio kitchen cabinet/counter, storage cabinets for the garage. Workshop workbench and cabinets, and a garden work center. I'm just getting started!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good value, especially compared to the Kreig jig. The same jig kit is at least $8.00 more than the Milescraft kit. The build quality is very good. I just got it so I can’t speak to the durability, but it feels like it’s well made. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Bushings too small for the drill bit.
customer_reviews.text: The bushings are two small for the drill bit. I know that it is supposed to be a tight fit but it is more than that. It is literally useless.
customer_reviews.author: PeaSnap

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use Jig for Pocket Holes
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say this is a "complete" set as you will need a clamp, but this works perfectly in making pocket holes if you already have one. There are directions online in how to setup this jig which is very simple and straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This cost significantly less that another better known brand, but it works really well! I quickly used the screws and hole plugs that were included, but I found refills for a great price! I would for sure buy again if something were to happen to my current set.
customer_reviews.author: PTR

customer_reviews.title: Great first experience and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing, I've never used a kreg jig but I cant imagine it working any better then this one?! I'm on bench #15 and it's still making the picket holes like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: T20 torx bit is better than the square bit
customer_reviews.text: T20 torx bit is better than the square bit that kreg comes with. But why on earth can't they just come with a long philips head bit?
customer_reviews.author: Toby Paddock

product_meta.title: Milescraft 1323 PocketJig200 Kit - Complete Pocket Hole Kit with Jig, Bit, Screws and Drivers,Black/Red
product_meta.description: Style:PocketJig200 - Old VersionThe Milescraft PocketJig200 allows you to connect your work pieces in a quick and timely manner. Whether you want to build storage projects, cabinets, shelves or bookcases, this kit does it all. Allowing you to create corner joints, T-joints, framing joints, Miter joints or do repairs. With built-in board thicknesses, there is no need to manually measure. Just set this jig to your desired setting, set the depth of your bit and start drilling. Includes everything you need to get started with your first pocket hole project. Includes a reusable plastic storage carrying case with designated places in the case for every single component. You will never have to go digging through your tool box for your pocket hole jig again.
feature_bullets: Built in imperial and metric scales allow you to easily measure the thickness of your work piece
There are 4 common board thickness settings built into the jig (1/2", 3/4", 1" and 1-1/2") with an easy read out arrow to help define your board thickness setting and easily adjust it
Includes a clamping magnet to allow you to easily secure the jig to your work piece using any standard metal clamp; for speed and accuracy, use the Miles craft 3" Face Clamp
Designed to make repairs simple with an easy flip fence that allows the jig to be set to do repairs of any nature around your home or shop
Hardened steel drill bushings allow for precise pocket holes every time using the Miles craft Pocket Bit

specifications.Included Components: Quick Connect, 1" - 2" Pocket Hole Screws, Drill Stop and Allen Key, T20 Drivers - 3" and 6", Pocket Jig 200, 3/8" Pocket Hole Bit, Plugs
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,441 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
